medical_history.chief_complaint: New eruption involving trunk, arms, and legs.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has had hypertrophic lichen planus on lower legs since the age of 5. Symptoms of lichen planus preceded the use of any oral medications and have been treated unsuccessfully in the past. Intermittent generalized pruritus has occurred for most of his life. The recent new eruption has developed alongside these longstanding symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertrophic lichen planus since age 5; treated with topical steroids, herbal medicines, and intralesional steroids.
